comments:
Choose New Connection > UNIX
On the "Files Subsystem" page, choose "IBM Server Launcher : Launcher Properties : Launcher"
When clicking on the Combo, nothing happens except for some debug prints on stdout:

Exiting ctor
inside setItems
in doSetValue: CCombo {}, Daemon
I tried this out with my windows driver and the combo seems okay.  Is this something you can reproduce on both windows and linux clients?

It works on Windows.
It fails on Linux-GTK.
This is now fixed so that combo selection is not processed until a change in selection has been made.

I played with the Server Launcher settings a little on Linux-GTK, and it took not long until I saw "SWT Exception: Widget is disposed" in the PDE Error Log.

Also, the widgets feel awkward to use, they seem to sometimes jump back to their original state. I tried switching to "RExec" and changing some settings. THen switch back to varous other Server Launcher Types.

Please check again.
I just fixed somethign else with this a second ago - could you do another update and see if that helps?

Update, still getting SWTException: Widget is disposed.
This time I opened the properties for the already created connection and modified the IBM Server Launcher properties by switching between Rexec / Daemon / Running several times.
I noticed that when I switched from RExec to Daemon, the RExec-specific properties would remain in the table and not be hidden. When I switch to Running they are hidden. At the same time I am getting the Widget disposed exception:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed

I guess the trick is:
* Switch to RExec
* Switch to Daemon (The RExec properties remain visible)
* Click on any of the RExec specific fields
Could you try comparing this to a new connection?  It's possible that the persistence from the previous connection is messing something up with the old one.

Reproduced with a new connection too:
* Switch to RExec
* Switch to Daemon (The RExec properties remain visible)
* Click on any of the RExec specific fields

Getting exactly the same traceback as for the properties of existing connection.
This is now fixed.  The problem had to do with the combo box thinking there was no selection change when the first item was selected.
